snippet: The acting State Department legal adviser told a United Nations panel that monitors torture that the United States had used cruel treatment after the Sept. 11 attacks.
abstract: Obama administration tells United Nations panel in Geneva that United States tortured terrorism suspects after September 11 attacks but that it has since taken steps to prevent any future use of unlawful, coercive interrogation techniques; admission before UN panel amounts to government’s most formal acknowledgment of torture before international community.

byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: The acting State Department legal adviser told a United Nations panel that monitors torture that the United States had used cruel treatment after the Sept. 11 attacks.
